case_vignette: A 15-year-old boy is brought to the physician with an ongoing pruritic rash for 1 week. The rash is on his right forearm (refer to the image). He has not had a similar rash in the past. He has no history of allergies, and he is not taking any medications. He frequently enjoys gardening in their backyard. They have no household pets. The physical examination reveals no other abnormalities.
question: Given the most likely diagnosis, which  is the most appropriate treatment of the condition described in this case?
